title: Get Custom Conversions associated with an event source

headers.name: Access-Token
headers.description: Authorized access token. For details, see Authentication .

parameters.name: event_source_type
parameters.description: Event source type. Enum values: PIXEL : Pixel. APP : App.

parameters.name: event_source_id
parameters.description: Event source ID. When event_source_type is PIXEL , specify a Pixel ID. To obtain IDs of Pixels within your ad account, use /pixel/list/ and check the returned pixel_id . When event_source_type is APP , specify the app platform ID of a Self Attribution Network (SAN) App. To obtain app platform IDs of SAN Apps within your ad account, use /app/list/ . Confirm that the returned self_attribution_enabled for the App is true and check the returned app_platform_id .

parameters.name: search_keyword
parameters.description: The keyword to search for Custom Conversions by. You can search by Custom Conversion name or Custom Conversion ID. When you search by Custom Conversion name, fuzzy matches are supported. When you search by Custom Conversion ID, exact matches are supported.

parameters.name: sort_field
parameters.description: Sorting field. Enum values: CREATE_TIME : The time when the Custom Conversion was created. TOTAL_COUNT : The total conversion count for the Custom Conversion. Default value: CREATE_TIME .

parameters.name: sort_type
parameters.description: Sorting type. Enum values: DESC : descending. ASC : ascending. Default value: DESC .

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Current page number. Value range: â‰¥ 1. Default value: 1.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: Page size. Value range: 1-1,000. Default value: 10.

top_fields.name: code
top_fields.description: Response code. For the complete list of response codes and descriptions, see Appendix-Return Code .

top_fields.name: message
top_fields.description: Response message. For details, see Appendix - Return Codes .

top_fields.name: request_id
top_fields.description: The log ID of a request, which uniquely identifies the request.

fields.name: list
fields.description: The list of Custom Conversions associated with the event source.

fields.name: custom_conversion_id
fields.description: The ID of the Custom Conversion.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the Custom Conversion.

fields.name: event_source_type
fields.description: Event source type. Enum values: PIXEL : Pixel. APP : App.

fields.name: event_source_id
fields.description: Event source ID. When event_source_type is PIXEL , this field represents a Pixel ID. To obtain IDs of Pixels within your ad account, use /pixel/list/ and check the returned pixel_id . When event_source_type is APP , this field represents the app platform ID of a Self Attribution Network (SAN) App. To obtain app platform IDs of SAN Apps within your ad account, use /app/list/ . Confirm that the returned self_attribution_enabled for the App is true and check the returned app_platform_id .

fields.name: activity_info
fields.description: Details of the activity for the Custom Conversion.

fields.name: activity_status
fields.description: The activity status of the Custom Conversion. Enum values: NO_RECENT_ACTIVITY : No recent activity. Activity received, but not in the past 7 days. ACTIVE : Active. Activity received in the past 7 days. WAITING_FOR_ACTIVITY : Inactive. No activity received in the past 90 days.

fields.name: total_count
fields.description: The total conversion count for the Custom Conversion.

fields.name: last_record_time
fields.description: The time when activity for the Custom Conversion was last received, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC+0). Example: 2025-01-01 00:00:01 .

fields.name: optimization_event
fields.description: The conversion event (standard event) associated with the Custom Conversion. For enum values, see List of values for optimization_event .

fields.name: rules
fields.description: Details of the conversion rules for the Custom Conversion. Only actions that meet these conditions will count as Custom Conversions.

fields.name: operator
fields.description: Operator. When parameter is BRAND , CONTENT_CATEGORY , CONTENT_ID , CONTENT_NAME , CONTENT_TYPE , DESCRIPTION , EVENT_ID , SEARCH_STRING , STATUS , or URL , the enum values are: CONTAIN : Contains. NOT_CONTAIN : Does not contain. START_WITH : Starts with. EQUAL : Is equal to. NOT_EQUAL : Is not equal to. When parameter is NUM_ITEMS , PRICE , or VALUE , the enum values are: EQUAL : Is equal to. NOT_EQUAL : Is not equal to. LT : Is less than. GT : Is greater than. LTE : Is less than or equal to. GTE : Is greater than or equal to. When parameter is CURRENCY , the enum values are: EQUAL : Is equal to. NOT_EQUAL : Is not equal to.

fields.name: values
fields.description: Values for the parameter. When parameter is BRAND , CONTENT_CATEGORY , CONTENT_ID , CONTENT_NAME , CONTENT_TYPE , DESCRIPTION , EVENT_ID , SEARCH_STRING , STATUS , URL , the field will be an array of strings, each with a maximum length of 100 characters and up to 100 entries. When parameter is NUM_ITEMS , the field will be an integer between 0 and 1,000,000,000. When parameter is PRICE , VALUE , the field will be a float kept to two decimal places, within the range from 0.00 to 1,000,000,000.00. When parameter is CURRENCY , the field will be an array of strings. To learn about the enum values, see List of currency values .

fields.name: create_time
fields.description: The time when the Custom Conversion was created, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC+0). Example: 2025-01-01 00:00:01 .

fields.name: update_time
fields.description: The time when the Custom Conversion was last updated, in the format of YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS (UTC+0). Example: 2025-01-01 00:00:01 .

fields.name: page_info
fields.description: Pagination information.

fields.name: page
fields.description: Current page number.

fields.name: page_size
fields.description: Page size.

fields.name: total_number
fields.description: Total number of results.

fields.name: total_page
fields.description: Total pages of results.
